page.title: 12HALL FARM
page.content: The farm covers 700 acres of arable land with barbed wire fencing and natural hedgerows. The largest field is 114 acres. The farmer and his 5 employees mainly grow wheat for seed. They also grow barley,oil seed rape, peas for animal feed and grass for silage. All crops, except peas and beet are autumn sown. The fields are spread with a variety of fertilizers including nitrogen, phosphate, potash,lime, magnesium, copper and farmyard manure. The crops are sprayed from the air with insecticides, herbicides and fungicides. They do not irrigate the crops. Beet-harvesters, combines and tractors are used for harvesting. Harvested crops are stored in grain bins on ventilated open floors. The crops' destinations are beet-factories and seed merchants throughout Britain.
